text: Gem is a city in Thomas County, Kansas, United States. As of the 2020 census, 98 people lived there. == History == Gem was a shipping point on the Chicago, Rock Island and Pacific Railroad. The town was named from the Gem Ranch. The first post office in Gem was created in 1885. It was closed in March 2014. == Geography == Gem is at (39.425730, -100.896294). According to the United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . All of it is land. == People == === 2020 census === The 2020 census says that there were 98 people, 37 households, and 28 families living in Gem. Of the households, 78.4% owned their home and 21.6% rented their home. The median age was 34.0 years. Of the people, 88.8% were White, 3.1% were Asian, 1.0% were Black, and 7.1% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 5.1% of the people. === 2010 census === The 2010 census says that there were 88 people, 36 households, and 26 families living in the city. == References == == Other websites == ;City * Gem - Directory of Public Officials ;Maps * Gem City Map , KDOT Category:Cities in Thomas County, Kansas
title: Gem, Kansas
